intro: Echites discolor, commonly known as the white-spotted spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a white, powdery coating. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-yellow and lack petals. Echites discolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
